oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bob McDill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1982 Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Bob McDill. The recording takes place on 04-14-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob McDill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (1:41) -- Bob Allen and Bob McDill discuss New England. (1:54) -- "If North America had been settled from West to East instead of East to West, New England would still be uninhabited." (2:26) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about a conference he went to at the University of South Carolina. (3:36) -- Bob McDill admires Robert Penn Warren. (4:09) -- Bob McDill discusses reviewing Robert Penn Warren's philosophical novel. (5:26) -- Bob McDill mentions Tom Colley showing his song "Good Ole Boys Like Me" to Robert Penn Warren at Yale. (6:56) -- Bob Allen and Bob McDill discuss the rest of the country's interest in the south. (9:23) -- Bob McDill discusses Uncle Tom's Cabin. (12:44) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about some of his favorite writers. (19:30) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about writing "Song Of The South." (20:56) -- Bob Allen discusses a film about the TVA. (25:30) -- Bob Allen asks about the song "Louisiana Saturday Night." (27:34) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his childhood. (29:44) -- Bob McDill discusses his writing process.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McDill, Bob;
